items.name: Cupid's Letter
descriptions:
My dearest Psyche,

I cannot bear to see you, but know that I still love you. You have angered my mother, Venus, by your mortal beauty that rivals her own. She will not allow our reunion until you prove yourself worthy.

Seek her at her Courtyard. She will set tasks for you - four impossible trials. Only by completing all four can we be together again.

Be brave, my love. Look for help in unexpected places.

Forever yours,
Cupid

P.S. Gather what you can from the cottage. You will need supplies for a long journey.

items.name: Garden Shears
descriptions: Iron shears with wooden handles. Used to cut vines and branches.

items.name: Honey Cakes
descriptions: Two honey cakes. Animals like to eat them. Use them to calm guard beasts.

items.name: Crystal Vessel
descriptions: An empty crystal vessel. It can hold water or any other liquid.
The vessel now has water from the River Styx. This water comes from the boundary between life and death.

items.name: Bronze Coins
descriptions: Bronze coins. Used to pay the ferryman to cross the River Styx to the underworld.

items.name: Music Box
descriptions: A music box engraved with images of sleeping animals. When wound, it plays a haunting lullaby that could calm aggressive creatures if played in the right place.

items.name: Overgrown Vines
descriptions: Thick thorny vines block the garden. A rose grows among them. You need garden shears to cut them.
The vines are cut. The Sacred Rose can now be taken.

items.name: Sacred Rose
descriptions: A glowing rose that carries the scent of Venus's favor. It's blocked by vines.
A perfect rose with petals that shimmer like mother-of-pearl. The rose will never wilt or fade.

items.name: Golden Pelt
descriptions: A golden fur pelt that glows like sunlight. It is warm and light. A sacred treasure.

items.name: Sealed Box
descriptions: A sealed box with Persephone's mark. It holds divine beauty. Do not open it or you will suffer.
You opened the box. A mist surrounds you. Your eyes grow heavy. You fall into eternal sleep. The gods' beauty was not for you.

items.name: Rose Altar
descriptions: The First Trial - Restore the Sacred Garden and bring forth the Rose of Venus.
The First Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your dedication to beauty and order.

items.name: Pelt Altar
descriptions: The Second Trial - Calm the savage guardians and claim the Golden Pelt they protect.
The Second Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your courage and cunning.

items.name: Vessel Altar
descriptions: The Third Trial - Bring water from the River Styx that flows beyond mortal reach.
The Third Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your resourcefulness and faith.

items.name: Box Altar
descriptions: The Fourth Trial - Journey to the depths of Hades and return with Persephone's sealed gift. DO NOT OPEN IT.
The Fourth Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your perseverance and self-control.

items.name: Signpost
descriptions:
→ Venus's Courtyard - 'Where the goddess judges mortals'
→ Lakeside - 'Follow the water's song'
→ Mountain Path - 'Climb toward the heavens'
→ Cave Entrance - 'Descent into darkness'
→ Cupid's Palace - 'The path of love'

items.name: Whispering Reeds
descriptions: Beware the meadow where fierce wolves guard their treasure... Do not approach with force or theft in your heart... Seek instead the silver music box that rests nearby... Its melody can soothe even the most savage beast... Play it where the wolves dwell, and they will sleep... Only then can you claim what they protect...

items.name: Styx Shrine
descriptions: Offer a vessel of flawless crystal to the depths below. Only such purity may withstand the river’s touch. Cast it from the ledge, and the Styx will return it—filled with what you dared request.

items.name: Ancient Tower
descriptions:
To walk among the dead and return to light, bring gifts:

- Coins of bronze for the silent ferryman
- Sweet cakes for the guardian with three mouths
- Take nothing from those who dwell below
- If the Queen offers a sealed gift, guard your curiosity well

Many descend. Few return. The curious sleep eternal in shadowed halls.

items.name: Obol Basin
descriptions: Cast your coin into the vessel, that the Ferryman may grant you passage.

items.name: Cerberus
descriptions: The three-headed dog Cerberus blocks the gate. All three heads snarl. He will not let you pass unless you give him what he wants. Honey cakes might work.
Cerberus eats the honey cake. All three heads fight over it. He calms down and lets you pass.

items.name: Persephone's Answering Machine
descriptions:
—beep—
Ahem. Hello? Is this thing on?
Right. If you’re here for the box, take it, but do not open it.
Seriously. Don’t.
—beep—

—beep—
Last one, I promise.
If you do open the box—
Well. There’ll be consequences. Cosmic ones. Messy ones.
Mostly for you. So… just don’t.
Alright?
—beep—

—beep—
[muffled footsteps… distant humming…]
Oh Tartarus, is this thing still recording?
—beep—

locations.name: Cottage
descriptions: A humble cottage where you, Psyche, have been living in exile since angering Venus. Empty and lonely without Cupid's presence.

locations.name: Crossroads
descriptions: A junction where multiple paths diverge. This is the heart of your journey - all roads lead from here.

locations.name: Venus's Courtyard
descriptions: A white marble courtyard that smells of roses and incense. Four marble altars stand in a semi circle. You must prove you completed the trials here. Each altar shows what it needs.

locations.name: Sacred Garden
descriptions: Venus's sacred garden.

locations.name: Lakeside
descriptions: A lake with clear water. Tall reeds grow at the edge and sway. They whisper secrets.

locations.name: Meadow
descriptions: A meadow with tall grass and wildflowers. Fierce wolves patrol here. They growl and watch you. In the center the Golden Pelt. You need to calm them first.
The meadow is peaceful. The wolves sleep in the grass. The music box made them sleep. You can take the golden pelt from the center now.

locations.name: Mountain Path
descriptions: A narrow path up the mountain, offering stunning views of the landscape. The air is thin. Rocks give shelter from wind.

locations.name: Cliff Edge
descriptions: An ancient offering site for the Styx. Far below, you see its glittering waters, boundary between the living and the dead.

locations.name: Cave Entrance
descriptions: A dark cave opens before you. Cold air flows out. It smells of earth and old stone. This is the gateway to the underworld. Few mortals who enter return.

locations.name: River Styx
descriptions: The River Styx flows black and silent. The water absorbs light and sound. On the shore Charon stands still pointing to the basin payment.
Charon, content with the payment, will now carry your soul to the underworld.

locations.name: Gates of Hades
descriptions: Cerberus the three-headed dog blocks the passage. He guards Hades. Each of his heads snarls at you, teeth bared. You need to bait him to pass through.

locations.name: Persephone's Hall
descriptions: Persephone's room. Queen of the Underworld. Strange flowers bloom here. The room is empty, with a blinking light on the side.

locations.name: Cupid's Palace
descriptions: Grand doors to Cupid's Palace, carved with hearts and wings. Sealed by magic. A plaque says: 'Love cannot be claimed until worthiness is proven. Complete all trials set by Venus and these doors will open.'
You enter the palace. Golden light fills it. Flowers bloom in bright colors. The air shimmers with joy and love. Cupid waits for you with happy tears.

endings.reason: You enter Cupid's Palace and find your true love. You completed all four trials. Venus cannot keep you apart. You proved yourself worthy. You and Cupid embrace. The palace fills with golden light. Love wins.

Time ran out. You took too long. Cupid waited and waited but you never came. He believed you died attempting the impossible trials. Heartbroken, he left. Now you will never find him. Your love story ends in separation.

The wolves awaken from their enchanted sleep and see you with their sacred treasure! In a fury, they attack. You stood no chance against the pack. The golden pelt falls from your lifeless hands. You should have left the meadow while the wolves still slumbered.

You opened Persephone's box. The divine beauty within was never meant for mortal eyes. A glittering mist envelops you, and an irresistible sleep descends. Your body crumples to the ground. You will sleep forever in the halls of Hades, another victim of curiosity and hubris. Persephone warned you, but you could not resist.
